page.title: 04Employment in Ringstead.
page.content: Long ago the employment in Ringstead was concerned mainly with agriculture. In 1871 ironstone was worked in quarries to the south of the village and in 1874 about 70 men were employed in them.Also at this time shoe-making became a prosperous industry.People would work in the village or walk to Raunds to work in the factories.In 1885 Ringstead people were involved in the following trades.There were 6 farmers, 9 shopkeepers,1 milliner,2 butchers, 5 shoe agents,1 blacksmith, 1 tailor,1 apiarist,1 draper,1 carpenter,1 wheelwright,1 post office,2 coal dealers,1 poulterer,2 carriers,1 poor rate collector,1 miller,2 bakers. The rest of the working people,out of a population of about 700 people were employed on farms,quarries and in shoe making.
